post.summary: Info returns all information about a selected environment.
List returns all environments or the ones in the selected account.
Quota returns usage and available capacity on a selected environment.

Use returns a new token for a selected environment. This operation returns a new
JWT that should be used when launching operations on a given environment.

status_name.description: StatusName with the string representation of the status.

user_info.description: UserInfo with additional information to show to the user.

playground_commonOpResponse.description:
OpResponse with a common definition for the result of executing an operation through gRPC. Notice that
in case of an error, the call must fail unless the operation is executed asynchronously and this
message contains the result of a past operation.

playground_commonOpStatus.description:
OpStatus enumeration defining the possible status of an operation.

 - UNKNOWN: Unknown operation status indicates an error in the processing of the request as all operations should
have a determined status.
 - SUCCESS: Success indicates that the operation was completed successfully.

account_name.title: AccountName with the name of the account where the token is valid

environment_name.title: EnvironmentName with the name of the account where the token is valid

playground_commonTokenResponse.description: TokenResponse is the message that contains the generated token and the refresh token.

account_id.description: AccountId with the parent account identifier.

name.description: Name with the pretty name of the environment for user facing operations.

environment_qualified_name.title:
EnvironmentQualifiedName (EnvQN) contains both the account name and the environment name as
<account_name>/<env_name>.
EnvironmentCreation can be called by account_id and environment_name or by environment_qualified_name

description.description: Description of the purpose of this environment.

set_as_default_environment.description: PrimaryEnvironment flag to know which is the primary/default environment for an account.

cpu.description:
Environment Quota requested
CPU in Kubernetes CPU units.

playground_environmentsCreateEnvironment.title: CreateEnvironmentRequest is the message to request the creation of a new environment

environment_qualified_name.description:
EnvironmentQualifiedName (EnvQN) contains both the account name and the environment name as
<account_name>/<env_name>.

force.title: Force is a flag to indicate that the environment is deleted even if it has applications deployed

playground_environmentsDeleteEnvironment.title: DeleteEnvironmentRequest is the message to request the deletion of an environment

description.description: Description of the purpose of this environment.

playground_environmentsEnvironment.description: Environment defining a workspace for a user or group of users associated with an account.

playground_environmentsEnvironmentListRe.description: EnvironmentListResponse with a list of selected environments.

cpu_quota.description: CpuQuota with the maximum CPU quota available for the user in Kubernetes CPU units.

used_cpu.description: UsedCpu with the number of Kubernetes CPU units used by the running user applications.

memory_quota.description: MemoryQuota with the maximum amount of memory available for the user in MB.

used_memory.description: UsedMemory with the memory used in MB by the running user applications.

storage_quota.description: StorageQuota with the maximum amount of storage available for the user in in MB.

used_storage.description: UsedStorage with the storage used in MB by the running user applications.

playground_environmentsEnvironmentQuota.description: EnvironmentQuota message containing quota information about a given environment.

description.description: Description of the purpose of this environment.

quota.description: Quota used and available on this environment.

playground_environmentsEnvironmentQuotaR.description: EnvironmentQuotaResponse message containing quota information about a given environment.

environment_qualified_name.description:
EnvironmentQualifiedName (EnvQN) contains both the account name and the environment name as
<account_name>/<env_name>.

playground_environmentsEnvironmentSelect.title:
EnvironmentSelector with information to determine the target environment. The current selected
environment as specified in the JWT will be used otherwise.
Keep in mind that we can select an environment through EnvironmentQualifiedName or
through the combination of AccountId and EnvironmentId, being incompatible the use of the two selectors at
the same time

account_name.description:
AccountName restrict if present the returned environments to the given account. Cannot be
used in conjunction with AccountId.

account_id.description:
AccountId restricts if present the returned environmetns to the given account. Cannot be 
used in conjunction with AccountName.

playground_environmentsListEnvironmentsR.description:
ListEnvironmentsRequest with information about the target account if the list is intended
to be limited to a single account. The current selected account as specified in the JWT
will be used otherwise.
